availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Payne (Fleming County, Kentucky, tavern keeper)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer and tavern keeper. Virginia native. Married to Frances Throckmorton in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on April 14, 1853. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. Tavern keeper in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 284B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 861.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 7.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252392, p. 222.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Centerville District, p. 398.
Find A Grave, "Robert Payne (1785-1869)," Memorial #152611517, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152611517 (accessed May 6, 2020).
